## `react no did update set state`

### `0`

```

 unknown:4:12 lint/react/noDidUpdateSetState ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

  ✖ Avoid calling this.setState in the componentDidUpdate method.

    2 │         class Hello extends React.Component {
    3 │           componentDidUpdate() {
  > 4 │             this.setState({
      │             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^
    5 │               name: 'John'
    6 │             });

  ℹ Updating state immediately after a previous update causes a second render that can cause visual
    layout thrashing.

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

✖ Found 1 problem

```

### `0: formatted`

```
class Hello extends React.Component {
	componentDidUpdate() {
		this.setState({
			name: "John",
		});
	}
}

```

	componentDidUpdate() {

class Hello extends React.Component {
	componentDidUpdate() {
		condition
			? this.setState({
					name: "John",
				})
